contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox military conflict |conflict= Battle of Wisternitz |partof=the [[Thirty Years War]] |image= |caption= |date= August 5, 1619 |place=[[Dolní Věstonice]] (present-day [[Czech Republic]]) |result= Bohemian victory |combatant1={{flagicon|Bohemia}} [[Kingdom of Bohemia|Bohemia]] |combatant2={{flag|Holy Roman Empire}} |commander1=[[Friedrich von Tiefenbach]](Teuffenbach) [[Ladislav Velen ze Žerotína]] |commander2=[[Henri Duval Coiunt of Dampierre|Dampierre]] |strength1=3,500 |strength2=8,000-12,000 |casualties1=700 |casualties2=6,000 }} {{Campaignbox Thirty Years' War}} The '''Battle of Wisternitz''' or '''Dolní Věstonice''' was fought on August 5, 1619 between a [[Moravia]]n force under [[Friedrich von Tiefenbach]] (Teuffenbach)<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=mZxDAAAAcAAJ&pg=PA35&lpg=PA35&dq=Wisternitz&source=bl&ots=ESrhFLVZi9&sig=TZZbmZGEtJqSqu6MpDW2uE7Vn30&hl=en&sa=X&ei=zT0DUJ-aFu-42QXF1ridCw&ved=0CDYQ6AEwADgK#v=onepage&q=Wisternitz&f=false Freiherr Friedrich von Teuffenbach (Tiefenbach) ousted imperial troops, did not follow up]</ref> and an [[Austria]]n army under [[Henri Duval Coiunt of Dampierre|Dampierre]]. The battle was a Moravian victory. The battle is part of the [[Thirty Years' War]]. Budweis ([[České Budějovice]]) was one of the three towns which remained loyal to the Austrian emperor when Bohemia revolted. After the Austrian victory at [[battle of Sablat|Sablat]], the Bohemians were forced to raise the siege of České Budějovice. On 15 June 1619, [[Georg Friedrich of Hohenlohe-Neuenstein-Weikersheim|Hohenlohe]] retreated to [[Soběslav]] where he awaited reinforcement by count [[Jindrich Matyas Thurn|Heinrich Matthias von Thurn]]. After taking control of the strong places of southern Bohemia, emperor [[Ferdinand_II,_Holy_Roman_Emperor|Ferdinand II.]] sent a force under Dampierre to Moravia, which had chosen the side of the Bohemian rebels. However, Dampierre was defeated at [[Dolní Věstonice]] ({{lang-de|Wisternitz}}) by Moravian forces under von Tiefenbach (brother of [[Rudolf von Tiefenbach]]) and [[Ladislav Velen ze Žerotína]] in August 1619, which left [[Moravia]] in the Bohemian camp. ==Notes== <references/> ==References== *William P. Guthrie. ''Battles of the Thirty Years War: From White Mountain to Nordlingen, 1618–1635''. Greenwood Publishing Group. Westport, Connecticut. 2002. ISBN 0-313-32028-4 *Radek Fukala. ''Sen o odplatě. Dramata třicetileté války''. Nakladatelství Epocha. 2005. ISBN 80-86328-84-8 {{coord missing|Czech Republic}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wisternitz}} [[Category:1619 in Europe]] [[Category:Battles of the Thirty Years' War|Wisternitz 1619]] [[Category:Battles involving the Holy Roman Empire|Wisternitz 1619]] [[Category:Battles on Czech lands|Wisternitz]] [[Category:Battles involving Bohemia]] {{Euro-hist-stub}} {{Czech-stub}} {{Austria-battle-stub}}
